intro: Cordyline excellens, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, sword-like leaves that can grow up to 3 meters in length. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that appear in panicles during the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used traditionally by Māori for its fibrous leaves. Cordyline excellens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
